panels.description: The Health panel displays the overall health for a given volume.
panels.title: Health

panels.description: The Bricks panel displays brick status information for a given volume, including the total number of bricks in the volume, and a count of bricks by status. For details, go to the Bricks Dashboard.

The Brick Status panel displays the status code of each brick for a given volume.  
0 = Started  
8 = Stopped
panels.title: Brick Status

panels.description: The Subvolumes panel displays subvolume status information for a given volume.
The Geo-Replication Session panel displays geo-replication session information from a given volume.
The Rebalance panel displays rebalance progress information for a given volume, which is applicable when rebalancing is underway.
The Rebalance Status panel displays the status of rebalancing for a given volume, which is applicable when rebalancing is underway.
panels.title: Rebalance Status

panels.description: The Snapshots panel displays the count of active snapshots for a given cluster.
panels.title: Snapshots

panels.description: The Capacity Utilization panel displays the used capacity for a given volume.
panels.title: Capacity Utilization

panels.description: The Capacity Available panel displays the available capacity for a given volume.
panels.title: Capacity Available

panels.description: The Weekly Growth Rate panel displays the forecasted weekly growth rate for capacity utilization computed based on daily capacity utilization.
panels.title: Weekly Growth Rate

panels.description: The Weeks Remaining panel displays the estimated time remaining in weeks till volume reaches full capacity based on the forecasted Weekly Growth Rate.
panels.title: Weeks Remaining

panels.description: The Capacity Utilization panel displays the volume capacity utilization over a period of time.
panels.title: Capacity Utilization

panels.description: The IOPS panel displays aggregated brick level read and write operations collected using “gluster volume profile info” over a period of time. The IOPS value shown only reflects metrics from volumes that have volume profiling enabled. No data will be shown if volume profiling is disabled for the selected volume.
panels.title: IOPS

panels.description: The LVM Thin Pool Metadata % panel displays the utilization of LVM thin pool metadata for a given volume.
panels.title: LVM Thin Pool Metadata %

panels.description: The LVM Thin Pool Data Usage % panel displays the LVM thin pool data usage for a given volume.
panels.title: LVM Thin Pool Data Usage %

panels.description: The Top File Operations panel displays the top 5 FOP (file operations) with the highest % latency, wherein the % latency is the fraction of the FOP response time that is consumed by the FOP.
panels.title: Top File Operations

panels.description: The File Operations for Locks panel displays the average latency, maximum latency, call rate for each FOP for Locks over a period of time.
panels.title: File Operations For Locks

panels.description: The File Operations for Read/Write panel displays the average latency, maximum latency, call rate for each FOP for Read/Write Operations over a period of time.
panels.title: File Operations for Read/Write

panels.description: The File Operations for Inode Operations panel displays the average latency, maximum latency, call rate for each FOP for Inode Operations over a period of time.
panels.title: File Operations for Inode Operations

panels.description: The File Operations for Entry Operations panel displays the average latency, maximum latency, call rate for each FOP for Entry Operations over a period of time.
panels.title: File Operations for Entry Operations
